Cardiovascular System

Card 1 of 15

Hypertension
Medical Term
Click to see definition
High blood pressure; a condition in which the force of blood against artery walls is too high.
Example: Regular exercise and a low-sodium diet can help manage hypertension.

Learn Medical Terminology with Interactive Flashcards

Master medical terminology with our comprehensive collection of interactive flashcards designed specifically for medical students, nursing students, and healthcare professionals. Our platform offers over 50 medical terms across multiple specialties including cardiovascular, respiratory, neurology, dermatology, musculoskeletal, and gastroenterology.

Why Choose Our Medical Terminology Hub?

Our medical flashcards platform provides an engaging and effective way to learn medical vocabulary. Each term includes detailed definitions, clinical examples, and real-world usage scenarios that help students understand how medical terminology is applied in healthcare settings.

Medical Specialties Covered

Cardiovascular: Heart and circulation terms
Respiratory: Lung and breathing terminology
Neurology: Brain and nervous system
Dermatology: Skin conditions and treatments
Musculoskeletal: Bones, muscles, and joints
Gastroenterology: Digestive system disorders

Features for Medical Students

Our platform includes study progress tracking, quick reference guides for medical prefixes and suffixes, common medical abbreviations, and keyboard shortcuts for efficient studying. The responsive design ensures you can study on any device, whether you're in the library, clinic, or on the go.

Perfect for Healthcare Education

Whether you're a pre-med student, nursing student, medical assistant, or healthcare professional looking to refresh your knowledge, our medical terminology flashcards provide a solid foundation in healthcare vocabulary. The interactive format makes learning engaging and helps improve retention of complex medical terms.
